plan: Plan to test the associative approach, restating value by previous bids' closeness to maximum. Then lowball strategy to measure potential profits when betting under average. Also, an equivalent bid to value strategy for consistency test. Lastly, aggressive overbidding above true value to grasp potential windfalls. Aim is to study these results, consolidate data and adjust future strategies based on these analysis.

Initial rounds will follow a moderate bidding strategy, bidding half of the prize value. This helps gather data on other bidder's behavior. If losing, increase bids to test aggressive strategy. If winnings are stable, experiment with lower bids to find a possibly better balance between risk and reward. Use previous round data to find trends in Andy and Charles's bidding habits and adjust bids to exploit this. Also apply random bidding sometimes to keep opponents guessing.

Plan to test a reactive strategy, adjusting bids based on previous rounds' highest bids. Initially start bidding at middle range, around $49, to both observe others' strategies and minimize early losses. Gradually increase or decrease bid by up to 10% depending on competition. Also, in rounds where value is extremely high, bidding aggressively up to $90 to capitalize. Alternatively, when value is low, considering underbid or intentionally losing to keep competition unaware of our strategy since winning these rounds is not profitable.

Testing a lowball strategy, underbid my value by almost 50% to understand lowest successful bids. Meanwhile, maintain occasional value bidding to monitor consistency. Lastly, overbid by 20% in a few cases to gather data on risky overbidding.

In the next don't rounds, elevate my bid to about 70% of the value to evaluate the results. If wins are infrequent, bid more aggressively, matching the value. Lastly, if stable, I'll adopt a riskier strategy, bidding significantly lower, to assess risk-reward balance.

Plan to progressively increase bids each round by 10%, while bidding aggressively for high values. For low values, bid conservatively to save on potential losses. Learn from each round's outcome and adjust the bidding strategy accordingly for maximum long-term profitability.

Experiment with a medium-risk strategy by bidding slightly above average previous winning bids. Revise the lowball tactic by reducing bid to 30-40% of value. Maintain occasional value-to-bid tests, and implement aggressive overbidding sporadically.

Next rounds, I'll predominantly bid at 80% of my value to test higher bid responses. Infrequently, I will underbid as before to keep my strategy unpredictable. I'll monitor opponents' trends to optimize my tactics to maximize my long-term profit.

Test aggressive strategy for high values again. For low values, underbid considering the risk of loss. Gradually adjust bids to be closer to previous rounds' highest bids. Observe competition's strategy and adapt for maximum profit.

Continuing on the exploration strategy, for upcoming auctions I plan to incorporate bidding patterns based on game progression, varying bid values between 40-70% of the drawn value, as well as rare, high-risk bids above value for outlier data. Particular attention will be paid to bid adjustments correlating with competitors' tactics.

Condensing the information gathered from previous rounds, I'll adapt a flexible bidding approach: approximating 80% of the value generally, randomly underbidding for uncertainty and monitoring opponent trends, while optimizing for minimal bidding above the second highest bid to maximize profit.

For high values test bidding closer to maximum value, taking calculated risks to win. For low values, maintain conservative strategy. Continue to adapt based on competitor behavior and bid trends for competitive and profitable outcomes.

Evaluate a more aggressive approach with occasional bids equalling value and a higher percentage of overbidding. Also, maintain a tactical lowball strategy less frequently. Observe competitor behaviour closely to adjust bids proactively for higher profit chances.

In future rounds, conservatively bid 70-80% of value. Occasionally, place a lower bid for unpredictability. Analyze opponents' trends to optimize tactics. Avoid excessive bids above the second highest. Focus on balancing risk with increasing total profit rather than individual round wins.

Continue testing aggressive strategy for high values, bid up to 80% of the value. For low values, underbid to mitigate losses. Use patterns from previous bidding rounds to predict competitors' strategies and adjust bids accordingly.

Proceed with strategy iteration by infusing 40-60% contact value bids, occasional value bids, and calculated overbidding. Increase usage of medium lowball bids based on previous rival bids. Explore risk management through graduated bid adjustments, noting fluctuations in competitors' tactics, to improve profit potential.

Plan to test a dynamic strategy, generally bidding 70% of value. Occasionally bid lower for unpredictability. Focus on trending patterns among opponents, aim for minimal overbid above the second highest. Balance risks with potential long-term profit increase.

Implement dynamic strategy: bid aggressively (up to 85% of value) for high values, conservatively for mid-values, and minimal for low values. Monitor competitors' bids closely to adapt accordingly for future rounds.

Plan to incorporate a mix of strategies: lowball bids around 30-40% of value, value equal bids, and sporadic aggressive overbidding above value by 10-20%. Also observe competitors' patterns closely for dynamic strategy adjustment.

Going forward, my strategy will involve primarily bidding 70% of value, unless patterns suggest it would be beneficial to bid higher. I will occasionally underbid to introduce unpredictability, while closely monitoring opponent trends and aiming for minimum necessary overbids.

For high values, bid around 75% of the value, for average values bid up to 60% and for low values, underbid. Continue learning patterns from competitors' bids to dynamically adjust own bid, maximizing profit.

Plan to explore a slightly assertive strategy, moderately overbidding than the value. Continue value equal bids, but mitigate aggressive lowball bids. Adapt bid based on previously successful competitors' bid range. Refine strategies as I gather more data.

Maintain bidding at roughly 70% of value. Incorporate unpredictable lower bids occasionally. Monitor opponents' trends and adjust bids to always slightly surpass second highest bidder when possible. Test modest variances in my bids to optimize profitability without overextending financially.

Plan: Continue observing competitor bids. For high values ($80-99), bid aggressively up to 90%. For mid-range ($30-$79), bid 50-70% of value. For low values (below $30), underbid with 10% of the value. Adapt strategy if recurring patterns are detected in competitors' bids.

Next, I'll incorporate a mix of cautious and assertive strategies: bids equivalent to value for consistent comparison, lowball bids of 20-30% of my value to test profit margins, and assertive overbids of 10-20% value. I'll adjust bids dynamically considering competitors' patterns and past round data.

I plan to following a temperate strategy, fluctuating between 70-80% value bids. Occasionally, I'll bid lower to create uncertainty. By pragmatically tracking opponents' trends, I'll aim to minimally outbid the second highest bidder. Adopting this variable strategy I believe will lead to optimization of profitability.

Plan: Maintain aggressive strategy for high values. For mid-range, adjust bids to around 45-60%. For low-value rounds, underbid. Monitor changing patterns in competitor bids and adjust bids strategically to maximize profits in the long run.

Next, plans include testing low-risk strategies by bidding near or slightly below value. Additionally, more strategic overbidding will be employed, based on competitors' past trends. Also, infrequent lowbids to understand lowest winning bid correlation with drawn values. The goal remains maximizing long-term profit while gathering data for strategic adjustments.

In subsequent rounds, follow a dynamic strategy, placing bids between 70-80% of the value. Introduce unpredictability through occasional lower bids. Continuously monitor opponents' trends and adjust my bids slightly above the second highest, testing varying degrees of aggressive bidding to optimize profitability.

Maintain aggressive strategy for high values, bidding up to 90% of value. For midrange values, adjust bids to around 50-70%. For low values, consider underbidding at about 10-30%. Keep strategizing dynamically based on observed competitor bids and past performance.

Continue to test mixed strategies by: bidding close to value for consistency; lowball bids around 20-40%; occasional overbatis at 10-20% above value, considering competitors' trends. Next, plan to introduce random high-risk overbidding to test profit boundaries.

In future rounds, main strategy will involve bidding around 80% of value. Still, assess other bidders' trends while incorporating unpredictability with occasional lower bids. Test subtle increases in bidding closer to value for high-value scenarios to potentially maximize profits.

Plan: For high values ($70-$99), bid aggressively around 85-90% of value. For average values ($30-$69), bid moderately (around 45-60%). For low values, bid conservatively (10-30%). Continue observing competitor behavior and adjust strategies to maximize profit.

Guided by past results, my future strategy will be a calculated mix of bidding slightly below value, lowball bids of 20-30%, and occasional aggressive overbidding of 10-20%. I'll dynamically adjust bids, observing competitors’ behavior, aiming to optimize profit margins and experiment with risk bounds.

Plan to increase bids to approximately 85% of value. Simultaneously, observe rivals' trends and adjust bid to exceed second highest bid minimally. Occasionally introduce unpredictability through random low bids. Closely monitor the outcome of this aggressive strategy for optimization.

Plan: Maintain aggressive bidding (80-90%) for high values ($70-$99). For average values ($30-$69), implement moderate bidding (50-70%). For low values, underbid conservatively (10-30%). Adjust strategies as patterns emerge in competitor bids to maximize long-term profits.

Continuing with a strategic mix, plan to test more lowball bids between 20-30% and 40-50% of value, along with frequent bids close to actual value. Introduce minor random overbidding up to 10% above value while considering competitors' pattern analysis text.

Plan to carefully increase bids to around 85% of the drawn value. Moreover, add elements of unpredictability with occasional low bids to throw off opponents. Continually evaluate opponent trends and adjust strategy to barely exceed second highest bids.

Plan: Apply aggressive strategy for high values by bidding up to 95%. Adaptively bid 55-70% for mid-range values. For low values, underbid at 10-30%. Continue to analyze competitors' behavior to refine bidding strategy, with a focus on long-term profitability.

Employ a dynamic strategy of testing low-risk, lowball bids of 20-40% value, regular bids near actual value, and occasional overbidding. Strategically adjust bidding based on competitor patterns and past results to understand winning thresholds, balance risk and reward, and maximize long-term profits.

Strategize primarily bidding 85% of the value. Regularly monitor opponent bidding patterns, adjust my bids to slightly beat the second highest. Occasionally bid lower for unpredictability. Adjust strategy based on results, maximizing profits over numerous rounds rather than each individual auction.

Next, test bidding 45-50% for mid-values, 95-99% for high values, and 5-10% for low values. Continuously adapt strategies based on competitor bids. Test sparingly aggressive bids in mid-range to capitalize on potential successes.

Test a diverse strategy: incorporate value-close bids, lowball bids around 20-30% of value, and cautious overbidding of 10-15%. Consider competitive trends and data from past results, adjusting bids dynamically. Introduce rare high-risk overbidding situations to explore profit limits.

Increase bid to 90% of value occasionally for aggressive play. Navigate to win with minimal overbid. Inject unpredictability with random lower bids. Monitor patterns closely, modifying strategy based on results. Strive for most profit overtime, rather than focusing individual auction win.

Next, test bidding aggressively at 90% for high values, 50% for middle values and 10% for low values. Also, experiment with matching the previous round's winning bid to test competitors' adaptability, while observing patterns for dynamic adjustments.
